result.execSummary:
The defendant Joel A Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.  Sentence credit for 365 days were granted.

miscConds.notes: Reimbursement for Buy Money to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for Waukesha County Metro Drug Unit as a condition of probation.  Costs/Surcharge to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommended.  No use or possession of illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Inform Agent of all prescriptions.  Disclose to any physician in writing your probation conditions.  Sign Medical Release for Agent.  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
Psychological Evaluation and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Huber with non-working hours with standard release conditions, Treatment Released approved by the court -To commence FORTHWITH.  After 6 months, the court may consider early release for the remaining 3 months.

Defendant Joel A Smith in court, in custody, with attorney Joseph Smith.   Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for defendant's motion for bail modification.  Statements made by both counsel.  Court grants defendant's request for bail modification.  Court orders Waukesha County Jail to obtain a blood sample from the defendant.  Pending results of blood sample.  Court would amend cash bond to a signature bond in the same amount with the additional conditions:  Defendant to be released to the custody of his father, Timothy Smith, for immediate transport to the Teen Challenge Program.  If defendant leaves program early or is unsuccessfully discharged this bond will revert back to the previous cash bond and defendant is to report back to the Waukesha County Jail immediately.
